results:
Based on my search results, I found comprehensive information about "Lalka" (The Doll) by Bolesław Prus in the context of the Polish school curriculum and matura exams for 2025:

## "Lalka" in Polish School Curriculum and Matura 2025

"Lalka" by Bolesław Prus is one of the mandatory readings for the Polish language matura exam, and it contains the most important issues concerning this book and a list of open questions that may appear on the 2025 matura exam.

### Historical Appearance on Matura Exams

"Lalka" has appeared on the matura exam six times in 16 years, with positivism being the favorite era of exam-takers.(no content)The novel appeared on the matura in 2021 as one of the essay topics students could choose.

### Student Reception

Students expected "Lalka" to appear, as it was "the reading that was talked about most often on our student exchange," and students were very satisfied with its appearance on the matura.(no content)"Lalka" is a reading that probably every high school student knows and it's one of the readings that are better "worked through" in school, making students pleased when it appeared on the exam.

### Key Themes for Matura 2025

Topics concerning "Lalka" that may appear on the 2025 Polish language matura include the motif of love, the genesis of the work, and features of the genre (realistic novel) visible in the work.

Some specific essay questions that have appeared or could appear include:
- Love - destructive or motivating force for action? Discuss the issue based on "Lalka" by Bolesław Prus.
- What role do wealth and origin play in interpersonal relationships? Discuss the issue based on "Lalka" by Bolesław Prus.
- Confrontation of dreams with reality. Discuss the issue based on "Lalka" by Bolesław Prus.

### Matura Exam Context

The written matura exam covers compulsory subjects at a basic level including Polish language, mathematics, modern foreign language, and national minority language for students who study in that language.(no content)After graduating from secondary school and passing the final exam called the matura, students can pursue higher education, with the exam being similar to the French baccalauréat.
